title: Height of water in a can part - c

content.description: A cylindrical can of radius 10 millimeters is used to measure rainfall in Stormville. The can is initially empty, and rain enters the can during a 60-day period. The height of water in the can is modeled by the function S , where S ( t ) is measured in millimeters and t is measured in days for <math> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mn> 60 </mn> </mrow> </math> . The rate at which the height of the water is rising in the can is given by S '( t )=2sin(0.03 t )+1.5.
content.question: Assuming no evaporation occurs, at what rate is the volume of water in the can changing at time t=7? Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: Assuming no evaporation occurs, at what rate is the volume of water in the can changing at time t=7? Indicate units of measure.

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
